thread.title: 16 gorgeous tattoos inspired by classical art that you never knew you needed until now
thread.title_full: 16 gorgeous tattoos inspired by classical art that you never knew you needed until now

author: Steph Barnes
title: 16 gorgeous tattoos inspired by classical art that you never knew you needed until now
text:
16 gorgeous tattoos inspired by classical art that you never knew you needed until now We didn’t choose the tattoo life; the tattoo life chose us. We could spend hours talking about why we love tattoos , from the edgy dream come true cartoon-style pieces to the more delicate blackwork designs — we want ’em all. And right now we’re obsessing over these beautiful classic art-inspired pieces. The incredible artists on this list have inked new life into some of the most iconic works of art ever created.
Great works of art are timeless and transcendent. Paintings like da Vinci’s Mona Lisa and Van Gogh’s Starry Night are permanently embedded into our memories because their cultural significance and beauty are inspiring to us all. As tattoos grow increasingly popular, many art lovers are using their bodies as canvases to display their favorite museum-worthy pieces.
1. Starry Night, Van Gogh 
A photo posted by Link For Ink -#ThinkBeforeUink (@thinkbeforeuink) on Jan 1, 2017 at 9:44pm PST 
2. The Creation of Adam, Michelangelo 
A photo posted by Phellipe Rodrigues (@phelliperodriguess) on Apr 21, 2016 at 9:57am PDT 
3. Frida Kahlo #artbae 
A photo posted by Fredão Oliveira (@fredao_oliveira) on Oct 21, 2016 at 7:22am PDT 
4. Leonardo da Vinci 
A photo posted by OOZY (최우진) (@oozy_tattoo) on Nov 10, 2015 at 7:53am PST 
5. Water Serpents, Gustav Klimt 
A photo posted by Amanda Wachob (@amandawachob) on May 18, 2016 at 9:47am PDT 
6. Pablo Picasso 
A photo posted by Olivia Harrison (@fearbear) on Aug 13, 2015 at 4:41pm PDT 
7. The Great Wave off Kanagawa, Hokusai 
A photo posted by OOZY (최우진) (@oozy_tattoo) on Oct 31, 2016 at 6:47am PDT 
8. Mona Lisa, Leonardo da Vinci 
A photo posted by MR. K ✘ BANG BANG TATTOO (@mr.k_tattoo) on Dec 22, 2016 at 2:24pm PST 

9. Le Chat, Pablo Picasso 
A photo posted by Cathy Johnson (@ladybird_tattoos) on Aug 2, 2014 at 7:54pm PDT 
10. Van Gogh inspired 
A photo posted by Tattoos and inspirink ✌ (@tattooinspirink) on Jan 3, 2017 at 8:57pm PST 
11. Dance, Henri Matisse 
A photo posted by OmegAlfa Tatuador (@omegalfa.tattoo) on Jun 20, 2016 at 7:36pm PDT 
12. Birthday, Marc Chagall 
A photo posted by Alina (@alinavstrkv) on Aug 18, 2015 at 6:47am PDT 
13. Judith and the Head of Holofernes, Gustav Klimt 
A photo posted by Ville Prinsen (@villeprinsen) on Jan 29, 2016 at 4:12pm PST 
14. Alphonse Mucha 
A photo posted by Natan Alexander (@natanink) on Mar 6, 2013 at 5:51pm PST 
15. Barking Dog, Keith Haring 
A photo posted by Megan Oliver (@_megan_oliver_) on Jul 30, 2014 at 6:41pm PDT 
16. Jackson Pollock 
A photo posted by Anton Senkov (@antonsenkou) on Jul 19, 2015 at 7:35am PDT 
These are all so great, we just can’t pick a favorite. BRB, we’re trying to figure out how to get them all!
